summary: This bill, the "Improve and Enhance the Work Opportunity Tax Credit Act," aims to modify the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to strengthen the Work Opportunity Tax Credit (WOTC). Key changes include increasing the credit amount, particularly for individuals employed longer and veterans. It also adjusts provisions concerning summer youth employees and long-term family assistance recipients. Additionally, the bill removes the age limit for qualified Supplemental Nutrition Assistance Program (SNAP) benefits recipients. The amendments are effective for individuals beginning work after December 31, 2024.
